com.stormpath.sdk.account

Interface AccountOptions<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Options
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccountCriteria

    public interface AccountOptions<T>
extends Options
    Account-specific options that may be specified when retrieving Account resources.
    Since:
    0.8

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T withAccountLinks()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated accountLinks are also retrieved in the same request (paginated).
      T withAccountLinks(int limit)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getAccountLinks() accountLinks} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of AccountLinks results to limit items.
      T withAccountLinks(int limit, int offset)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getAccountLinks() accountLinks} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with the first page of AccountLinks results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items.
      T withCustomData()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's customData is also retrieved in the same request.
      T withDirectory()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's parent directory is also retrieved in the same request.
      T withFactors()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getFactors() are also retrieved in the same request (paginated).
      T withFactors(int limit)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getFactors() factors} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the quantity of Factors per page to limit items.
      T withFactors(int limit, int offset)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getFactors() factors} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with Factor results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items.
      T withGroupMemberships()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated groupMemberships are also retrieved in the same request (paginated).
      T withGroupMemberships(int limit)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getGroupMemberships() groupMemberships} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of GroupMembership results to limit items.
      T withGroupMemberships(int limit, int offset)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getGroupMemberships() groupMemberships} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with the first page of GroupMembership results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items.
      T withGroups()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's assigned Account.getGroups() groups} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated).
      T withGroups(int limit)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's assigned Account.getGroups() groups} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of group results to limit items.
      T withGroups(int limit, int offset)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's assigned Account.getGroups() groups} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated) , with the first page of Group results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items.
      T withLinkedAccounts()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated linkedAccounts are also retrieved in the same request (paginated).
      T withLinkedAccounts(int limit)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getLinkedAccounts() linkedAccounts} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of linkedAccounts results to limit items.
      T withLinkedAccounts(int limit, int offset)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getLinkedAccounts() linkedAccounts} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with the first page of linkedAccounts results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items.
      T withPhones()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getPhones() are also retrieved in the same request (paginated).
      T withPhones(int limit)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getPhones()} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the Phone results to limit items.
      T withPhones(int limit, int offset)
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getPhones() are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with Factor results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items.
      T withTenant()
      Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's owning Account.getTenant() tenant} is also retrieved in the same request.

    • Method Detail

      • withCustomData

        T withCustomData()
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's customData is also retrieved in the same request. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • withTenant

        T withTenant()
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's owning Account.getTenant() tenant} is also retrieved in the same request. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • withGroups

        T withGroups()
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's assigned Account.getGroups() groups} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated). This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

        If you wish to control pagination parameters (offset and limit) for the returned groups, see the withGroups(limit) or withGroups(limit,offset) methods.

        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • withGroups

        T withGroups(int limit)
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's assigned Account.getGroups() groups} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of group results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of results in the Group collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • withGroups

        T withGroups(int limit,
             int offset)
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's assigned Account.getGroups() groups} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated) , with the first page of Group results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of results in the Group collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
        offset - the starting index of the first Group to retrieve in the overall Group collection's result set.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • withGroupMemberships

        T withGroupMemberships()
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated groupMemberships are also retrieved in the same request (paginated). This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

        If you wish to control pagination parameters (offset and limit) for the returned groupMemberships, see the withGroupMemberships(limit) or withGroupMemberships(limit,offset) methods.

        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

        T withFactors()
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getFactors() are also retrieved in the same request (paginated). This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

        If you wish to control pagination parameters (offset and limit) for the returned factors, see the withFactors(limit) or withFactors(limit,offset) methods.

        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • withFactors

        T withFactors(int limit)

This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of results in the Factor collection. Min: 1, Max: 100.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • withFactors

        T withFactors(int limit,
              int offset)
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getFactors() factors} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with Factor results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of results in the Factors collection. Min: 1, Max: 100.
        offset - the starting index of the first Factor to retrieve in the overall Factors collection's result set.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • withAccountLinks

        T withAccountLinks(int limit,
                   int offset)
        Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getAccountLinks() accountLinks} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with the first page of AccountLinks results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of results in the AccountLinks collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
        offset - the starting index of the first linkedAccount to retrieve in the overall AccountLinks collection's result set.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        1.1.0
